title: Waiver
description: A Waiver is an explicit, human-authored artifact that temporarily permits a scoped exception to a specific rule/check for a specific run.

gate_id.description: Gate identifier where the waiver applies.

rule_id.description: Exact rule identifier (or reference) being waived.

scope.description: Scope description for the waiver. Use 'path:<prefix>' for path-based scopes with deterministic prefix matching.

approver.description: Approver identity. For tier >= 1 (audit-grade), MUST use 'human:<identity>' format (e.g., 'human:jane.doe@example.com'). For tier-0, any non-LLM/agent string is accepted.

created_at.description: RFC3339 datetime when the waiver was created.

expires_at.description: RFC3339 datetime when the waiver expires (expiry is required).

storage_ref.description: Local, repo/bundle-relative POSIX path only. MUST NOT start with '/'. MUST NOT contain '..', '*', '?', '\\', '://', ':', '//', or './'.

AuditTrailRef.description: Reference to an audit trail record (id + storage reference).
